entry.title: Activities
entry.content:
Upcoming talks

None

Past talks

  • 2021 AMS Spring Southeastern Sectional Meeting, Special Session on Superalgebras, Quantum Groups, and Related Topics.
    Talk: Skew representations of super Yangian
  • Rocky Mountain Representation Theory Seminar, Zoom, March 11, 2021.
    Talk: Skew representations of super Yangian
  • Representations and Lie Theory, @ Ohio State University, Zoom, February 17, 2021.
    Talk: Skew representations of super Yangian
  • 2020 AMS Spring Central Sectional Meeting, @ Purdue University, West Lafayette, IN, April 4-5, 2020, canceled due to COVID-19.
  • Joint Mathematics Meetings 2020, @ Colorado Convention Center, Denver, CO January 15-18, 2020.
    Talk: On the $\mathfrak{gl}_{1|1}$ supersymmetric XXX spin chains.
  • Algebra seminar, @ University of Virginia, Charlottesville, VA, November 15, 2019.
    Talk: Jacobi-Trudi identity, Berezinian, and transfer matrices
  • Physically inspired mathematics seminar, @ University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill, NC, October 4, 2019.
    Talk: Supersymmetric quantum spin chains
  • 2019 AMS Fall Central Sectional Meeting, @ University of Wisconsin-Madison, Madison, WI, September 14-15, 2019.
  • Representation Theory and Integrable Systems, on the occasion of the 60th birthday of V. Tarasov and the 70th birthday of A. Varchenko, @ ETHZ, Zurich, Switzerland, August 12-16, 2019.
    Talk: On the supersymmetric XXX spin chain associated to $\mathfrak{gl}_{1|1}$
  • 2019 AMS Spring Eastern Sectional Meeting, @ University of Connecticut, Hartford, CT, April 13-14, 2019.
    Talk: On the supersymmetric XXX spin chain
  • 2019 AMS Spring Southeastern Sectional Meeting, @ Auburn University, Auburn, AL, March 15-17, 2019.
    Talk: Self-dual Grassmannian and Representations of \(\mathfrak{gl}_N\), \(\mathfrak{sp}_{2r}\), and \(\mathfrak{so}_{2r+1}\)
  • Representation Theory, Mathematical Physics and Integrable Systems, in honor of the 60th birthday of N. Reshetikhin, @ CIRM – Luminy, June 4-8, 2018.
  • Algebraic Analysis, in honor of Masaki Kashiwara’s 70th birthday, @ IHÉS, June 6-9, 2017.
  • Representation Theory at the Crossroads of Modern Mathematics, in honor of A. Kirillov’s 80th birthday, @ Université de Reims Champagne Ardenne, May 29-June 2, 2017.
    Poster: Self-dual Grassmannian and Representations of \(\mathfrak{gl}_N\), \(\mathfrak{sp}_{2r}\), and \(\mathfrak{so}_{2r+1}\)
    Picture: click here.
  • 2017 AMS Spring Central Sectional Meeting, @ Indiana University, Bloomington, IN, April 1-2, 2017.
    Talk: Bethe ansatz method in Gaudin Model
  • Algebra, Geometry and Combinatorics Day (ALGECOM-13), @ University of Notre Dame, April 30, 2016.
  • Lie Algebras, Vertex Operator Algebras, and Related Topics, in honor of J. Lepowsky and R. Wilson, @ University of Notre Dame, Aug 14-18, 2015.

entry.title: Citations by others
entry.content:
On the Gaudin model associated to Lie algebras of classical types

  1. L Rybnikov, A proof of the Gaudin Bethe Ansatz conjecture
  2. Peng Liu, Wei-Dong Ruan, Yang-Yang functions, Monodromy and knot polynomials

Self-dual Grassmannian, Wronski map, and representations of \(\mathfrak{gl}_N\), \(\mathfrak{sp}_{2r}\), \(\mathfrak{so}_{2r+1}\)

  1. A Molev, Sugawara operators for classical Lie algebras
  2. J Levinson, K Purbhoo, A topological proof of the Shapiro-Shapiro conjecture

Solutions of \(\mathfrak{gl}_{m|n}\) XXX Bethe ansatz equation and rational difference operators

  1. JM Maillet, G Niccoli, L Vignoli, Separation of variables bases for integrable $gl_{\mathcal M|\mathcal N}$ and Hubbard models
  2. D Chernyak, S Leurent, D Volin, Completeness of Wronskian Bethe equations for rational $\mathfrak{gl}(m|n)$ spin chain
  3. AJ Gerrard, Nested algebraic Bethe ansaetze for orthogonal and symplectic spin chains Only cited in reference

On the supersymmetric XXX spin chains associated to $\mathfrak{gl}_{1|1}$

  1. JM Maillet, G Niccoli, L Vignoli, Separation of variables bases for integrable $gl_{\mathcal M|\mathcal N}$ and Hubbard models
  2. D Chernyak, S Leurent, D Volin, Completeness of Wronskian Bethe equations for rational $\mathfrak{gl}(m|n)$ spin chain

Jacobi-Trudi identity and Drinfeld functor for super Yangian

  1. Zengo Tsuboi, Boson-Fermion correspondence, QQ-relations and Wronskian solutions of the T-system

entry.title: Homepage
entry.content:
Personal Information

I am a Visiting Assistant Professor at University of Denver and my mentor is Andrew Linshaw. I received my Ph.D. in Mathematics from Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI), advised by Evgeny Mukhin.

  • Email: Kang$\cdot\mathbb{LU}@\mathsf{DU}\cdot\mathsf{edu}$
  • Address: Knudson Hall 104, 2390 S. York St., Denver, CO 80208
  • Name in Chinese: 陆康
  •   My CV

Education

  • Aug. 2020, Ph.D., Department of Mathematical Sciences, IUPUI
  • Jul. 2014, M.S., Department of Mathematics, Zhejiang University
  • Jul. 2010, B.S., School of Mathematical Sciences, Fudan University

Research Interests

Generally speaking, I am interested in Representation Theory and Quantum Algebras.

More specifically, my current research interests are: Bethe ansatz method, Representation Theory of Quantum Groups, Lie Algebras and Superalgebras, and Integrable System.

Preprints

See also arXiv

  1. Gelfand-Tsetlin bases of representations for super Yangian and quantum affine superalgebra
    Mar. 16, (arXiv:2103.08758), submitted.
  2. Fine gradings of complex simple Lie algebras and Finite Root Systems
    (with Gang Han, Jun Yu), 29 Oct. 2014. (arXiv:1410.7945) not for publication.

Publications

See also MathSciNet.

  1. Bethe ansatz equations for orthosymplectic Lie superalgebra and self-dual superspaces
    (with E. Mukhin), Mar. 31, 2021, (arXiv:2103.16729), accepted by Annales Henri Poincaré.
  2. On the supersymmetric XXX spin chains associated to $\mathfrak{gl}_{1|1}$
    (with E. Mukhin), Commun. Math. Phys. 386 (2021), 711–747, (arXiv:1910.13360)
  3. Jacobi-Trudi identity and Drinfeld functor for super Yangian
    (with E. Mukhin), Jul. 31, 2020. (arXiv:2007.15573), Int. Math. Res. Not. IMRN.
  4. Perfect integrability and Gaudin models
    SIGMA 16 (2020), 132, 10 pages, (arXiv:2008.06825).
  5. Solutions of \(\mathfrak{gl}_{m|n}\) XXX Bethe ansatz equation and rational difference operators
    (with Chenliang Huang, E. Mukhin), J. Phys. A: Math. Theor. 52 (2019) 375204 (31pp), (arXiv:1811.11225)
  6. On the Gaudin model of type \(G_2\)
    (with E. Mukhin), Commun. Contemp. Math. 21 (2019), no. 3, 1850012, 31 pages, (arXiv:1711.02511)
  7. Multiplicity free gradings on semisimple Lie and Jordan algebras and skew root systems
    (with Gang Han, Yucheng Liu), Algebra Colloq. 26 (2019), no. 1, 123-138, (arXiv:1611.03943)
  8. Lower bounds for numbers of real self-dual spaces in problems of Schubert calculus
    SIGMA 14 (2018), 046, 15 pages, (arXiv:1710.06534)
  9. Self-dual Grassmannian, Wronski map, and representations of \(\mathfrak{gl}_N\), \(\mathfrak{sp}_{2r}\), \(\mathfrak{so}_{2r+1}\)
    (with E. Mukhin, A. Varchenko), Pure Appl. Math. Q. 13 (2017), no.2, 291 – 335 , a special issue of in honor of Yuri Manin’s 80-th birthday, (arXiv:1705.02048)
  10. On the Gaudin model associated to Lie algebras of classical types
    (with E. Mukhin, A. Varchenko), J. Math. Phys. 57 (2016), 101703, 23 pages (arXiv:1512.08524)

My Erdös Number: 4.
Paul Erdős–>Shizuo Kakutani–>Karl Endel Petersen–>A. N. Varchenko–>Kang Lu

entry.title: Teaching
entry.content:
University of Denver

  • MATH 1952 Calculus II, 2021 Spring
  • MATH 2070 Introduction to differential equations, 2021 Winter
  • MATH 1150 Introduction to Cryptography, 2021 Winter
  • MATH 1951 Calculus I, 2020 Fall (2 sessions)

IUPUI

  • MATH 15300: College Algebra, 2020 Spring
  • MATH 22100: Calculus for Technology I, 2020 Spring
  • MATH 15400: Trigonometry, 2019 Fall (2 sessions)
  • MATH 26600: Ordinary Differential Equations, 2019 Summer II
  • MATH 22100: Calculus for Technology I, 2019 Spring
  • MATH 11100: Intermediate Algebra, 2018 Fall
  • MATH 15400: Trigonometry, 2018 Summer II
  • MATH 11000: Fundamentals of Algebra, 2018 Spring

entry.title: Step-by-step guide to Webassign
